sanitizedJobDescription.content:
Formed in 1964, Henick-Lane Inc., is a leading east coast provider of reliable, cost effective and state-of-the-art HVAC construction, installation and maintenance service. The company is currently seeking qualified candidates to work as an Intern in the Estimating department. The position is for full time applicants.

Description:

  • Reading, understanding and interpreting design drawings including mechanical layouts and architectural layouts and specifications.
  • Learning and assisting in design suggestions as related to cost reductions of designs
  • Learning pricing structures and methods to mechanical systems
  • Assist in purchasing and/or obtaining quotations
  • Assist in estimating piping and duct work systems
  • Attend walk through of construction site, learning and assisting in methodology of construction of mechanical systems.

Qualifications:

  • A baccalaureate degree in mechanical engineering, construction management from an accredited college.
  • Strong analytical, conceptual, communication and organizational skills.
  • Ability to effectively interface with all levels of personnel and management.
  • Ability to work and thrive in a team environment.
  • Strong problem solving skills.
  • Ability to self-motivate and work productively without supervision.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.

Internship Program:
A full time intern will start in our estimating department, guided by our Chief Estimator with over 20 years of experience in the industry. A performance review will be done after five months of the hire date to establish a full time salary position for the person(s).

After the five month period, based on the feedback from the the Chief Estimator and the intern candidate, the person is typically promoted to our project management or estimating team to learn the other phase of operations in the industry.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be a complete list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. Duties and responsibilities may be added or changed as deemed appropriate by management at any time.

We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, national origin, sexual orientation, age, sex, predisposing genetic characteristics, marital status, domestic violence victim status, disability or military status.

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Pay: $15.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • Bachelor's (Preferred)

Work Location:

  • One location

Work Remotely:

  • No
